2. use strong passwords: hackers can easily guess weak passwords or use brute force attacks to crack them. to protect yourself, make sure your passwords are complex and unique for each social media account. you could also consider using a password manager to generate and store strong passwords for you.

3. regularly update software and devices: software updates often include security patches that can help protect against vulnerabilities. make sure you have the latest versions of all software, including your operating system and any applications you use.

4. be wary of suspicious links: hackers often try to trick people into clicking on malicious links that will compromise their accounts or devices. don't click on links from unknown sources, and make sure you trust the source before clicking on a link.

5. delete accounts or apps you no longer use: the more accounts you have, the more opportunities there are for hackers to gain access to your personal information. make sure you only keep the social media accounts that you actively use and delete any others that you don't need.
